title: Busway Ticket Chatbot
excerpt: Innovative web app for seamless busway ticket reservations, using Neo4j to manage complex data relationships.
overview: The Busway Ticket ChatBot is an innovative web application created during the Object Technology/IoT Workshop. It's designed to streamline the busway ticket reservation process, leveraging the power of Neo4j to manage complex data relationships. This project aims to provide users with a seamless and intuitive ticket booking experience.
features: Trip Visualization: Users can view available trips and detailed information about bus routes, including departure and arrival times.
Online Reservation: Allows users to book tickets online, providing a hassle-free reservation experience.
Dynamic Data Management: Utilizes Neo4j for sophisticated management of buses, drivers and stations.
User-Friendly Interface: Designed with the end-user in mind, ensuring easy navigation and interaction.
Chatbot: Provides a conversational interface for users to interact with the system, making ticket booking more engaging.

title: Centralization and Classification of New York City Traffic
excerpt: Web portal for analyzing and visualizing traffic centrality in NYC, developed during Object/IoT Technologies workshop.
overview: Developed as part of the Object/IoT Technologies workshop, web portal crafted to analyze and visualize traffic centrality within the bustling urban landscape of New York City.
features: Dynamic map visualization with zoom and pan functionalities.
Filterable data based on year, month, day, and time slots.
Color-coded clusters to represent different traffic flows.
Detailed information on traffic flow accessible via map markers.
Responsive design for optimal viewing on desktop and mobile devices.
Multi-language support for a global audience.

title: ZStore
excerpt: Dynamic ecommerce web app with JEE, MVC, Hibernate, and MySQL for seamless online shopping experiences.
overview: ZStore is a dynamic ecommerce web application that employs JEE technologies and adheres to the MVC architecture. This application is designed to facilitate seamless online shopping experiences, backed by a MySQL database that safely manages product and user data. As a key developer in this project, I spearheaded the integration of Hibernate for object-relational mapping and contributed significantly to developing the front-end using JSP, enhancing user interactions and overall site responsiveness.
features: User-friendly interface for easy navigation and product search.
Dynamic product catalog with detailed descriptions and images.
Shopping cart functionality for adding and managing products.
Backend administration panel for managing products, orders, and users.

team.name: Ismail ZAHIR
team.role: Software Engineering Student at FST Mohammedia - UH2C

title: Sudoku
excerpt: Desktop game developed using a backtracking algorithm to generate and solve Sudoku puzzles.
overview: The game is developed using a backtracking algorithm to generate and solve the Sudoku puzzles. The algorithm works by filling in the grid with numbers from 1 to the grid size (9 for a standard 9x9 Sudoku grid) aleatorily. If the number is valid, it moves on to the next cell. If the number is not valid, it tries the next number. If no number is valid, it backtracks to the previous cell and tries a different number. This process is repeated until the grid is filled.
features: Classic Sudoku gameplay with a clean, intuitive interface.
Multiple difficulty levels to challenge both beginners and seasoned players.
Enhanced audio effects for an immersive experience.
